name: Soba
product_long_description:
Soba is a product feedback platform written in Ruby on Rails. Companies can register accounts very quickly create feedback websites for their products. Features include:
- Subscription Management through Stripe integration
- Subdomain scoped multi-tenancy with Postgres
- Workers that interface with several external APIs such as Steam, Reddit, Discourse, Discord
- Dynamic/assignable user permission system based on Pundit

name: Aggo
product_long_description: Aggo is an iOS app designed to help you reach your goals, form new habits, and be the best version of yourself.

name: Take a Breather
product_long_description: Sometimes at work I find myself needing a small break. Too often, this leads to mindlessly tabbing through different social media or shopping sites before I realize I've lost 15 or 30 minutes of productivity. This app encourages you to take conscious breaks by popping up before you access particular sites that you specify.

name: Snooz
product_long_description: Snooz is an alarm app that helps you break your bad snoozing habits by making you donate to a charity every time you oversleep or hit the snooze button.

name: Francisco
product_long_description: Francisco is project management software. It features unique case number generation, note/activity tracking, file upload/management, todo assignments and reminder e-mails. It also integrates with Quickbooks and Harvest for automatic invoice generation.

name: Tavern
product_long_description: Tavern is a whisky encyclopedia and social network. You can rate whiskies that you've had, and record their flavor profile. Among other things, it features a recommender system to suggest other whiskies you may like.

Tavern is a whisky encyclopedia and social network that allows you to record whiskies you’ve tried, explore flavor profiles and get recommendations based on your preferences. I worked with a team of five over the course of several months (part-time) in the role of lead backend developer and project manager. I made appropriate architectural decisions to ensure scalability, maintainability and performance.
The backend is written in Elixir using the Phoenix framework backed by a Postgres for storage and GenServer processes for caching. It serves a GraphQL API that’s consumed by a React/Apollo powered frontend bundled with Webpack.

name: Zombies!
product_long_description: Zombies! is a 2d procedurally generated pixel art multiplayer survival game. You can work together with your fellow humans, or hunt them down for supplies.

name: Medical Genetics Mastery
product_long_description: This is a flashcard system originally designed for a genetics board exam. It has a Rails backend with an administrative interface and an API that connects to a React Native frontend.

name: DTrace
product_long_description: This app lets you pair your phone with golf clubs

name: Monocount
product_long_description: Monocount is a Magic: The Gathering life counter that I made soon after React Native first came out. I had originally developed and released the app in Objective C, but I wanted to explore what React Native was capable of. It was a great fit, and I've been happily using React Native ever since. :)
